choices.C: They used "FREE" in the promotional content.
choices.A: They have sent too many emails recently around the same promotion.
choices.D: They sent to a large number of unengaged subscribers.
choices.B: They sent on a day with high email volume like black Friday.

discussion.content: D is answer. Unengaged emails contains bounces

Selected Answer: D
Free in content should not do bounce. Answer should be D

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters sends a broadly targeted promotional email and notices a very high bounce rate compared to their typical sends.
What could be causing this spike in bounces?

choices.A: Recurring Send Schedule via Guided Send

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to send a promotional offer every Friday morning between 9:00 and 11:00 a. m. The content of the email will change on a weekly basis. The promotional email will be sent to subscribers in the Promotions Data Extension.
What send method should be used to minimize errors?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. (A - You can't automate this, it is manual each time; B - this is not applicable here since we are not trying to take action based on anything the user did; D - Same as A, 100% manual, can't be scheduled to repeat weekly at the exact time)

d is answer 
Send Flow replaces Guided Send for Content Builder emails in Email Studio. Send Flow allows you to see what you are sending to reduce errors, and consolidates all major sending functionality into a simple, highly visual interface.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_es_send_email.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
Why not C?

Selected Answer: B
Answer should be b as trigger sends can do the scheduling. Not guided access flows

Selected Answer: B
B, trailhead recommends for winback/dormant (low click/ low open) to reengage, send preference centre survey: https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/einstein-engagement-scoring-in-marketing-cloud/use-engagement-personas-in-journey-builder

Selected Answer: C
It should be C

comments.content: C is wrong sending mails more frequently to unengaged subscribers impact the ip reputation

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) sends a hiking newsletter to an audience that has opted to receive messages about hiking. They have noticed in the last six months their open and click rates have been trending lower. NTO wants to reverse this trend.
How should they improve their engagement rates with unengaged subscribers?

choices.B: In the Shared Data Extensions folder
choices.C: In the Data Extensions folder with sharing enabled
choices.A: In the Synchronized Data Extensions folder

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants multiple business units to access the same data extension within its Enterprise 2.0 account.

Where should the data extension reside to achieve this goal?

A marketer has started using Datorama Reports to enhance their email performance and engagement monitoring.

Which feature should improve Datorama Dashboard usability?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The feature that should improve Datorama Dashboard usability for a marketer monitoring email performance and engagement is:
â€¢ C. Tags
Tags allow for better organization and categorization of data, making it easier to filter and analyze specific segments within the dashboard. This enhances usability by providing a more streamlined and efficient way to manage and interpret data.

Selected Answer: C
Come on... Tags
